result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Zavarion J Mohomes

records.addlTxt: ADA Theresa Louise Lewandowski appeared for the State. Attorney Charles Andrew Ver Hoeve appeared in person with Defn. Offer received. Attorney Ver Hoeve asks for one additional STC. Attorney Only STC scheduled.

9:34 AM Defendant Zavarion J Mohomes in court with Attorney Crystal A. Vera on behalf of Attorney Charles Andrew Ver Hoeve.  ADA Thersa Louise Lewandowski in court for the State of Wisconsin. Information was E-filed with the court and a copy was given to the defendant; Defendant waived reading of Information; Defendant stood mute, Court enters plea of Not Guilty; motions due in 20 days; bail continued. 

Court agrees to quash bench warrant issued yesterday.

2:19 PM Defendant Zavarion J Mohomes not in court.  Attorney Charles Andrew Ver Hoeve in court for Zavarion J Mohomes.  ADA Thersa Louise Lewandowski in court for the State of Wisconsin. 
Court and parties address defendant not being in Court. State requests bench warrant. Court grants body only bench warrant. If Defendant appears by noon tomorrow Court will quash warrant.
and notice of DNA and witness list - State's

records.descr: Demand for Discovery and Inspection - Defendant

records.addlTxt: 9:58 AM Defendant Zavarion J Mohomes in court.  Attorney Charles Andrew Ver Hoeve in court for Zavarion J Mohomes.  Prosecuting attorney Trisha L Simmons in court for the State of Wisconsin. State moves to find cts 1 and 2 to be transactionally related. Defn has no objection. CT finds that cts 1 and 2 are transactionally related. Fitchburg Police Officer J. H., duly sworn and testified. Direct Exam by ADA Simmons. Venue established. Witness identification. Cross Exam by Atty Ver Hoeve. Witness excused. State moves for bind over, argument. Defn objected to bind over. Argument by Atty Ver Hoeve. CT found PC this defn committed a felony and bound over to branch 2.
Preliminary hearing on September 13, 2022 at 09:30 am.

Your signature bond is set in the amount of $500 per case. You may be responsible for paying this amount if you miss a court date or do not follow conditions of your release. 
- Defendant shall not be at New Vision Networks. 
Parties stipulated to waive the time limits for Preliminary Hearing.
Trial Judge - Br 2

1:49 PM Defendant Zavarion J Mohomes in court, in custody.  Attorney Charles Andrew Ver Hoeve in court for Zavarion J Mohomes.  Prosecuting attorney Tomas Fernando Valerio in court for the State of Wisconsin. The defendant was advised regarding their right to an attorney and to the SPD application process if not already represented. Defendant received a copy of the Complaint and waived reading.
Status conference scheduled for November 7, 2022 at 02:40 pm.
Status conference on November 7, 2022 at 02:40 pm.
